reviews.review_text: it heats well, but the default setting when you turn it on is 86° and the thermostat is about 4° off. if I want it to be 72°, i have to set it on 76. the remote has all similar colors, so the controls are a bit difficult to see in dim light. but, it heats and thats what i bought it for.
does its job warming my room (12x12. Doesn't heat a 12x25 room though.

reviews.title: Cheap heat
reviews.review_text: If you need to get heaters and can't afford to spend too much, these will do the trick, however if you have more to spend, duraflame is a bit nicer without breaking the bank. I ordered 2. One came in satisfactory condition, the other arrived with the front sticker around the controls peeling off and the digital display not showing the entire number, so I returned that one to the store without any difficulty. The digital display does not show the current temperature, just what it is set to. Also if you unplug and move, it resets to about 86° and you need to reset it. However it looks nice and keeps a large bedroom warm.
Unit said not to use without casters but did not come with casters

reviews.title: Heater
reviews.review_text: I purchased this heater, to add a little extra heat in our home this winter. I opened the box to make sure that it wasn't damaged and closed the lit. I'll get it out and try it when the temperature drops to the point that I need to use it.

reviews.title: Not a fedex issue since damage was interior box
reviews.review_text: ceived the heater earlier today. Fedex made delivery and outer box was undamaged. when i opened shipping box i discovered the manufacturers box was smashed which had to be done prior to shipping. I opened the box and discovered the heaters particle board cabinet was cracked on the side where the box was damaged. There were also large scratches on the top and sides, also? thr advertised remote and instruction book were missing. i now have to make the 40 mile trip to drop this sent out damaged heater to Fedex or walmart since my printer is not working.
does not blow heat much at all and i had ordered two for my camper

reviews.title: Mine was a lemon
reviews.review_text: Made a rattling noise and blew cold air

reviews.title: Not bad but needs help
reviews.review_text: Needs to have on/off switch on the remote.. Also needs wheels

reviews.title: Space heater
reviews.review_text: I bought this for supplemental heat and it works well. I have used the "milkhouse " type heaters before and they do not heat larger areas as well.

reviews.title: Small
reviews.review_text: Thought I bought 6 element but it’s super tiny , bought for my mom @ if she wants to return I saved the box

reviews.title: remote
reviews.review_text: its a good heater, but has to be turned up an down more than I should have to. Have to be in front of heater for remote to work
my mom/dad had an older heater like this and still working

reviews.title: didn't break the cold
reviews.review_text: didn't break the cold but did break the breakers

reviews.title: Pretty Darn Good
reviews.review_text: Although, it is never a good idea to leave a space heater on overnight or unattended, I would feel more comfortable doing that with this one, over any other I've owned. It has a heavy duty cord, tip over switch and over-heat protection. The only con that I have found is, that the wood around the opening does get a little hot when operated on high, but stays cool in the low position, which by the way is the ONLY setting I use. It's ability to heat a room is greatly diminished on the low setting.

reviews.title: Didn't last long
reviews.review_text: Well this product worked great we used for 2 weeks then put back in box for summer months. Then pulled out this winter to use and it worked for about 2 days at like 2 hours a day total. Now when its turned on it turns off by itself almost like a reset or over heating. But its not old or been used for more than 40 hours. Not sure whats going on with this maybe its just faulty. Wish it lasted longer than 40 hours.
Arrived dented. But I used for one week and it worked well in most conditions. I would not use a primary heat source although it could easily heat a room all day long.
